CONSENT ORDER 
Thismatteris beforethe Courtattherequest ofPlaintiffUnited States ofAmericaand 
Defendant Nettleton Line Consolidated School District, now known as Nettleton School District 
(the "District").  The District operates under a June 19, 1970 school desegregation order.  The 
desegregation order and applicable federal law require the District to eliminate the vestiges of 
racial discrimination, to the extent practicable, in its student assignments, faculty and staff hiring 
and assignments, school transportation, extracurricular activities, school construction and 
facilities, and student transfers.  The District currently operates three schools (Nettleton Primary 
School, Nettleton Middle School, and Nettleton High School, which includes the Ninth Grade 
Academy).  The District enrolls approximately 1,338 students (25% black and 74% white). 
In August 2010, the United States learned that the District's policies and procedures 
allowed for race-based selection and election procedures for extracurricular activities in grades 
6-12, including class officers (~, President, Vice-President, SecretarylTreasurer, and Reporter), 
homecoming court (~, queen and maids), and superlatives~, "Class Favorite," "Most 
Beautiful and Most Handsome," and "Mr. and Mrs. Nettleton"). Following media reports 
concerning the race-based election process, the District released a written statement that,

"Beginning immediately, student elections at Nettleton School District will no longer have a 
classification ofethnicity" and that "[fJuture student elections will be monitored to help ensure 
that this change in process and procedure does not adversely affect minority representation in 
student elections." 
After discussion and negotiation between the parties, the District agreed to terminate all 
race-based selection and election procedures and policies, and to revise such policies and 
procedures regarding student elections to comport with the desegregation order and applicable 
federal law.  On August 27,2010, the District formally adopted revised policies and procedures 
that govern student selection and elections in extracurricular activities.  A copy ofthe District's 
new procedures is appended as Attachment A and incorporated herein by reference. 
Having duly considered the issue, the Court finds that the actions embodied in this 
Consent Order comport with the Fourteenth Amendment and applicable federal law, and will, if 
properly implemented, further the orderly desegregation ofDistrict schools in compliance with 
the extant orders of this Court.  THEREFORE, IT IS HEREBY ORDERED, ADJUDGED, 
AND DECREED as follows: 
I.  Extracurricular Activities 
A.  The revised policies and procedures set out in Attachment A are approved and shall 
govern student selection and elections procedures in District schools. 
B.  A copy ofthe revised policies and procedures, with a cover letter to be approved by 
counsel for the parties explaining the basis for the change, shall be sent to the parents or 
guardians ofDistrict students and posted on the District's website within thirty (30) days ofthe 
date ofthis Order.

II.	  Reporting Requirements 
The District shall provide the following information to the United States by July 1 for 
each academic year that this Consent Order is in effect: 
A.  The yearbooks/annuals produced for each school for each academic year.  Ifthe 
yearbook/annual is not available by July 1, the District shall produce it as soon as it becomes 
available. 
B.  A copy ofthe ballot(s) and completed vote tally sheet(s) for each election held in 
the school district, including, but not limited to, class officers, homecoming court, and 
superlatives.  The tally sheets shall be accompanied by a chart denoting the race of each student 
who is listed as receiving votes. 
III.	  Enforcement 
The parties commit to negotiate in good faith any disputes that may arise, but the United 
States shall have the rightto seekjudicial resolution ofany noncompliance with the terms ofthis 
Consent Order. 
IV.	  Effect of Prior Orders 
All other orders ofthe Court remain in full force and effect.

STUDENT ELECTIONS 
Grades Kindergarten - 5th grade do not have any student elections. 
Class Officer Elections and Student Council: 
In grades 6 - 12, there will be annual elections in each grade for class officers in the following 
categories:  President, Vice-President, SecretaryITreasurer and Reporter.  Each grade will elect 
one person for each ofthe above categories as that grade level's class officers.  Candidates must 
meet the criteria listed below.  Elections will be held with only members ofeach grade level 
being able to vote for their class officers.  The winning candidate will be the student with the 
most votes.  There will be no run-offs. 
Criteria for class officer: 
•	  A student may run for only one office per year. 
•	  The student must submit an application with 10 signatures from students in the same 
grade level. 
•	  The student must have attended the Nettleton School District the previous school year for 
both semesters. 
•	  The student must have passed all subjects taken the previous year at the end ofthe last 
semester. 
•	  The student must have a cumulative 3.0 GPA for his or her career at the school. 
•	  The student must currently be in good disciplinary standing. 
•	  The student must not be currently referred to the truancy officer. 
Class Favorite Elections: 
In grades 6 - 12, there will be annual elections in each grade for class favorites.  There shall be a 
male and female elected as class favorite for each grade.  Candidates must meet the criteria listed 
below.  Elections will be held with only members ofeach grade level being able to vote for their 
class favorites.  The winning candidates will be the male student with the most votes and the 
female student with the most votes.  There will be no run-offs. 
Criteria for class favorite: 
•	  ·The student must have attended the Nettleton School District the previous school year for 
both semesters.  . 
•	  The student must have passed all subjects taken the previous school year by the end of 
the last semester. 
•	  The student must have a cumulative 2.0 GPA for his or her high school career. 
•	  The student must currently be in good disciplinary standing. 
•	  The student must not be currently referred to the truancy officer.

Most Beautiful and Most Handsome-Nettleton Middle School-Elections: 
In grades 6 - 8, there will be annual elections in each grade for most beautiful and most 
handsome.  There shall be a female student elected as most beautiful for each grade level, and 
there shall be a male student elected as most handsome for each grade level.  Candidates must 
meet the criteria listed below.  Elections will be held with only members of each grade level 
being able to vote for their grade most handsome and most beautiful.  The winning candidate for 
most beautiful will be the female student with the most votes, and the winning candidate for 
most handsome will be the male student with the most votes.  There will be no run-offs. 
Criteria for most beautiful and most handsome: 
•	  The student must have passed all subjects taken the previous school year by the end of 
the last semester. 
•	  The student must have a cumulative 2.0 GPA for his or her Middle school career. 
•	  The student must currently be in good disciplinary standing. 
•	  The student must not be currently referred to the truancy officer. 
Mr. and Mrs. Nettleton Middle School Elections: 
In grades 6 - 8, there will be annual elections for Mr. and Mrs. Nettleton Middle School from the
 
8th grade class only.  There shall be a female student elected as Mrs. Nettleton Middle School
 
from the 8th grade, and there shall be a male student elected as Mr. Nettleton Middle School from
 
the 8th grade.  However, all students in grades 6 - 8 will be allowed to vote for these positions.
 
Candidates must meet the criteria listed below.  The winning candidate for Mrs. Nettleton
 
Middle School will be the female student with the most votes, and the winning candidate for Mr. 

Nettleton Middle School  will be the male student with the most votes.  There will be no run­

offs.
 
Criteria for Mr. and Mrs. Nettleton Middle School:
 
•	  Student must be in the 8th grade. 
•	  The student must have attended the Nettleton School District the previous school year for 
both semesters. 
•	  The student must have passed all subjects taken the previous year at the end ofthe last 
semester. 
•	  The student must have an overall 3.0 GPA for his or her Middle School career. 
•	  The student must currently be in good disciplinary standing. 
•	  The student must not be currently referred to the truancy officer.

Homecoming Court Elections: 
In grades 9-11, two girls will be nominated from each homeroom.  Each grade will vote on its 
nominations so that each grade 9-11 has two girls on the homecoming court.  Each homeroom in 
the 1ih grade will nominate four girls.  Candidates must meet the criteria listed below. 
th 
The 12 grade will then vote from this slate of girls, and the six girls with the most votes will be 
on the homecoming court and will be the nominations for the homecoming queen.  All of grades 
9-12 will then vote from this slate ofsix girls.  The girl with the most votes will be declared the 
homecoming queen during the homecoming celebration.  (The other five girls will be senior 
maids.) 
Criteria for Homecoming Court: 
•	  The student must have attended the Nettleton School District the previous year for 
both semesters.  . 
•	  The students must have passed all subjects taken during the previous school year by 
May. 
•	  The student must have a cumulative 2.0 GPA. 
•	  The student must currently be in good disciplinary standing. 
•	  The student must not be currently referred to the truancy officer.
